date: stated on August 17, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: There's no evidence of Ronald Reagan saying this about gun control.
text: Recent mass shootings have stimulated calls for greater arms control, and some questionable Facebook articles on this issue. On 17 August, for example, Facebook users began to share a picture that attributed this quote to former President Ronald Reagan: "The delivery of weapons and ammunition cannot be carried out under any pretext; any attempts to disarm people by force must be stopped if necessary." This article, in which more than 5,300 times participated, was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misinformation in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) We've reached out to the Ronald Reagan Foundation and the Institute about this position. Melissa Geller, the chief marketing officer of the organization, told us that she had searched all of its archival records and could not find a reference to the quotation. The distinguished fact-finding bloggers mentioned on January 10, 2021 in the story of "The Rebel Law - General Flynn will be appointed Vice-President." We were also unable to find a reliable source attributed to Reagan, although in 1983 he told the National Republican Army that "no American who seeks to protect his family from fear and harm will be disarmed," according to Newsweek. However, many sources, such as Cooligan, the Walla Walla University Journal in Washington, D.C., cited the German philosopher Carl Marx as a writer for the Facebook article. According to the work of Carl Marks collected, he said it during the 1850 address to the Communist League in London. The Facebook mail is wrong, so we evaluate his claim is wrong.
